CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 17, 1959, pg. 4, reads: "'Ma Pitts' Goes to Rest - The remains of a business woman, identified throughout her mature life as 'Ma Pitts,' are removed from Wesley Center AME Zion Church for burial, last Tuesday. Her correct name, Mrs. Erin Godfrey, was known only to her family and a few close friends. She was an expert cook, thrived on a 16 hour workday, and operated her most lucrative restaurant at Townsend St. and Wylie Ave. for over 10 years, until foreced to vacate to make way for the Urban Redevelopment program. Pall bearers are (not in order) Lane L. Lee, James Miles, Harvey Washington, Douglass Childs, John Jones and Arthur Johnson. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Six pallbearers, including Lane L. Lee, James Miles, Harvey Washington, Douglass Childs, John Jones, and Arthur Johnson, carrying casket down Wesley Center AME Zion Church steps for funeral of Erin "Ma Pitts" Godfrey
